bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CONNOLLY:H.R. 304.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 of the Constitution of theUnited States.[Page H359]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.title: FAIR Act

item.text:
Federal Adjustment of Income Rates Act or the FAIR Act

Increases the rates of basic pay for federal employees under the statutory pay systems (relating to the General Schedule, the U.S. Foreign Service, and the Veterans Health Administration) for calendar year 2016, and for prevailing rate employees for FY2016, by 3.8%.
item.name: Introduced in House

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.title: Federal Adjustment of Income Rates Act
To increase the rates of pay under the statutory pay systems and for prevailing rate employees by 3.8 percent, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
